results.title: Steamed Cod with Ginger and Scallions

steps.step: In a deep sided saute pan, swirl together the rice vinegar (or stock), soy sauce, and ginger. Slice the cod into 4 fillets of the same size and season both sides of the fish with salt and pepper.

Place the fillets in the pan and place over medium heat. Bring the liquid to a gentle boil, then cover and lower heat to a simmer. Cook for about 8 minutes, periodically spooning the liquid over the fillets.Meanwhile, slice the scallions into three inch pieces crosswise. Take the green portions and thinly slice lengthwise. When the cod has steamed for about 8 minutes, Scatter the scallions over the fillets and cover again. Cook for an additional 2 minutes, or until the fish is cooked through and opaque.
Serve immediately. I love this over rice noodles (which cook very quickly, 5 minutes or less) or steamed rice.

ingredients.name: fresh ginger
ingredients.original: 2 tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and grated or julienned
ingredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and grated or julienned
ingredients.originalName: fresh ginger, peeled and grated or julienned

ingredients.name: rice vinegar
ingredients.original: 3 tablespoons rice vinegar (alternatively, chicken stock may be substituted)
ingredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons rice vinegar (alternatively, chicken stock may be substituted)
ingredients.originalName: rice vinegar (alternatively, chicken stock may be substituted)

ingredients.name: soy sauce
ingredients.original: 2 tablespoons soy sauce 2 tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and grated or julienned 1 1/2 pounds cod fillets, skinless 6 scallions

ingredients.originalName: soy sauce 2 tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and grated or julienned 1 1/2 pounds cod fillets, skinless 6 scallions

steps.step: Arrange two oven racks evenly spaced in upper and lower third of oven. Preheat oven to 325 degrees F. Fit steel blade attachment in food processor and turn on. Drop garlic clove through feed tub and allow to process until finely chopped. Open and add pepper, almonds, oil and salt and process until a thick paste forms. Scrape pepper mixture into a very large bowl.
Spread around surface of bowl.
Add kale and toss to combine. Work pepper mixture by hand into the leaves of all the kale to make sure it is evenly coated.
Spread over two large baking sheets.
Transfer kale to oven, and bake 10 minutes. Rotate baking sheets top to bottom and front to back. Continue baking, rotating again until crisp, but not brown 5 to 10 minutes more.
Let cool before eating.

ingredients.original: 16 cups kale leaves without stems, washed and spun dry

steps.step: Blitz the garlic and coriander in a small food processor, and then add the black beans and hot sauce. Season generously, and blitz again until smooth. Top with fresh chopped coriander to serve, if desired.

steps.step: In a large bowl, add kale, half of lemon juice, 1 tablespoon oil and salt. Massage kale with your hands until the kale starts to soften and wilt, about 2 to 3 minutes.In a small bowl, whisk remaining lemon juice with freshly ground black pepper and 3 tablespoon of oil while whisking until it emulsify (like a dressing form), and you like how it tastes.
Add the dressing, mango (and any nuts or seeds if using) into the kale. Toss and serve.

steps.step: Place vinaigrette and figs in a blender or food processor; process until blended.
Place in a large sealable plastic bag with steak and turn to coat. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 6 hours or up to 24 hours.Preheat grill to medium.
Remove the steak from the marinade; discard marinade. Oil the grill rack (see Tip). Grill the steak for 4 to 6 minutes per side for medium-rare depending on thickness.

Transfer to a clean cutting board. Season with salt and pepper, tent with foil and let rest for 5 minutes.Meanwhile, warm cheese in a small saucepan over medium-low heat, stirring often, until melted. Carve the steak into thin slices.
Serve each portion with a dollop of the cheese sauce.

ingredients.original: 1/3 cup herb & garlic creamy cheese spread, such as Boursin

steps.step: Cut all vegetables into one inch chunks, spread evenly on a baking sheet. Rub both sizes of beef with oil and salt.
Place beef on top of the vegetables.
Bake it at 400F, for about 12 minutes.
Remove all vegetable from under the beef and continue baking beef for another 7-10 minutes, depending on how well you want it done. You can broil beef on high for about a minute, to brown it.
Remove beef from heat, let it sit for about a minute. Slice it into thin slices and place them over vegetables.
Serve while its warm, it's the best that way.

Bake it at 400F, for about 12 minutes.
Remove all vegetable from under the beef and continue baking beef for another 7-10 minutes, depending on how well you want it done. You can broil beef on high for about a minute, to brown it.
Remove beef from heat, let it sit for about a minute. Slice it into thin slices and place them over vegetables.
Serve while its warm, it's the best that way.

results.title: Cobb Salad with Blue Cheese Dressing

steps.step: Watch how to make this recipe.

For the blue cheese dressing: In a bowl, whisk together the mayonnaise, buttermilk, sour cream and Worcestershire until smooth. Stir in the blue cheese crumbles, chives, salt and pepper. Taste and add more seasoning if needed. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving; the flavors deepen as it chills!
Heat a grill pan or heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
Drizzle on a small amount of olive oil.
Salt and pepper the chicken, then grill until totally done, 2 to 3 minutes per side.
Remove from the pan and set aside to cool.

For the salad: Arrange the Bibb, romaine and iceberg lettuce in a large bowl or on a large platter in 3 separate sections. Arrange the bacon, tomatoes, eggs and avocados in different piles. Pile the blue cheese crumbles in the center, scatter over the scallions and sprinkle the whole salad with a little black pepper.
Drizzle the blue cheese dressing all over the salad and serve.
